Name: Bitbucket
Code review: yes— Using Mercurial Queues And Bitbucket.org
Bug tracking: yesAnyone can submit Bug Reports without logging in.
Web hosting: yesPublishing a Website on Bitbucket – Bitbucket – Atlassian Documentation . Confluence.atlassian.com. Retrieved on 2013-09-21.
Private repository: YesLimited to 5 users on free plan (see Pricing - bitbucket.org)
Release binaries: noIssue #11404 – Bitbucket equivalent of GitHub Releases? (BB-13572)
Self-hosting: Commercially (Bitbucket Server formerly Stash)Self hosted version is known as BitBucket Server and only supports Git repositories

Name: Buddy
Build system: yesBuilds are run in Docker containers

Name: GitHub
Bug tracking: Yesno file attachments, but images can be embedded GitHub Issue Tracker — GitHubRequires one to log in to report a Bug.
Private repository: YesLimited to 3 users on free plan (see Pricing - github.com)

Name: GitLab
Self-hosting: YesHas an open source Community Edition and commercial Enterprise Edition

Name: Helix TeamHub
Build system: Yes, with hooks. Jenkins, TeamCity, etc.

Name: Launchpad
Private repository: YesCurrently only available for security vulnerability updates

Name: SourceForge
Private repository: YesPrivate repositories can be used to set up a project before going live. However, SourceForge requires that the project remains open source. See SourceForge Support.
